description.narrative: The purpose of this grant is to increase the capacity of Africa 24 Media Limited to train and mentor young people in journalism and communication as well as to support the USADF Office of the President in providing communication-related services to further strengthen USADFs brand identity and expand the Africa 24 Media's capacity to identify, train, and mentor young interns in journalism, as indicated by:.- selecting and training at least 60 youth from across Africa in communication writing, filming, photography, editing, and content creation for digital media and equipping interns with skills that give them an avenue to earn a living..- organizing and conducting an Africa continent-wide competition for the 60 trained youth through which (i) 30 winners will be selected (six from each of five regions: East Africa, West Africa, South Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa) and provided journalism equipment (ii) another 5 winners (one from each region) selected and provided placement with Africa 24 on a contract basis as part of the Yebo team and (iii) another 5 winners (one from each region) selected and provided job placements (contract basis) with partners of Africa 24..- linking the trained interns with media leaders across the African continent and mentoring them to increase their capacity for both job placement and self-employment..- upgrading and enhancing Africa 24's Yebo digital platform in terms of response and interactivity both on the website and on the mobile application.

title.narrative: YALI - Goolamally Keep Moving CO LTD

description.narrative: Youth unemployment in Mauritius is due in part to the mismatch between the skills of job seekers and the needs of employers. Ishis growing his online skills matching platform to automatically connect supply and demand. When skilled workers are not available; he works with the hiring companies to identify skill sets and offer job-specific training to candidates for those open positions.

title.narrative: Young African Leaders Initiative (YALI) - Jungee - Nineteen-Fifty Design & Print

description.narrative: The digital printing and outdoor media advertising sector in Mauritius contributes tons of waste to landfills each year. Nazeem wants to take the polyvinyl chlorides (PVC) produced from this waste and transform it into materials for recycled, reusable tote bags.

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I St. NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005

title.narrative: Africa 24 Media Video on Demand Project

description.narrative: Africa 24 Media Limited seeks to increase its capacity to create and disseminate positive, informative, and capacity-enhancing content across Africa as well as support USADFs Office of the President in providing graphic design-related services to further enhance USADFs branding standards and visual communication products. Africa 24 will develop and disseminate (i) a 13-part, 15-minute How it Works web series, (ii) a 13-part, 5-minute Agribusiness web series, and (iii) a 13-part, 30-minute Entrepreneurship web series.
